pli-tv-bu-vb-pc35:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing confession

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc35:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc35:1.1.eng: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc35:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro brāhmaṇo bhikkhū nimantetvā bhojesi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc35:1.2.eng: a certain brahmin had invited the monks for a meal.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc35:1.3.pli: Bhikkhū bhuttāvī pavāritā ñātikulāni gantvā ekacce bhuñjiṃsu ekacce piṇḍapātaṃ ādāya agamaṃsu.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc35:1.3.eng: When the monks had finished and refused an invitation to eat more, they went to their respective families, where some ate and some took away almsfood.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc35:1.4.pli: Atha kho so brāhmaṇo paṭivissake etadavoca—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc35:1.4.eng: Soon afterwards that brahmin said to his neighbors,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc35:1.5.eng: “The monks have been satisfied by me.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc35:1.6.eng: Come, and I’ll satisfy you, too.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc35:1.7.pli: Te evamāhaṃsu—“kiṃ tvaṃ, ayyo, amhe santappessasi?

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc35:1.8.pli: Yepi tayā nimantitā tepi amhākaṃ gharāni āgantvā ekacce bhuñjiṃsu ekacce piṇḍapātaṃ ādāya agamaṃsū”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc35:1.8.eng: Those monks who were invited by you came to our houses. Some of them ate there and some took away almsfood.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc35:1.9.pli: Atha kho so brāhmaṇo ujjhāyati khiyyati vipāceti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc35:1.9.eng: That brahmin complained and criticized those monks,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc35:1.10.pli: “kathañhi nāma bhadantā amhākaṃ ghare bhuñjitvā aññatra bhuñjissanti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc35:1.10.eng: “How could the venerables eat in our house and afterwards eat elsewhere?

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc35:1.11.eng: Am I not able to give them as much as they need?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc35:1.12.pli: Assosuṃ kho bhikkhū tassa brāhmaṇassa ujjhāyantassa khiyyantassa vipācentassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc35:1.12.eng: The monks heard the complaints of that brahmin,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc35:1.13.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc35:1.13.eng: and the monks of few desires complained and criticized those monks,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc35:1.14.pli: “kathañhi nāma bhikkhū bhuttāvī pavāritā aññatra bhuñjissantī”ti …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc35:1.14.eng: “How could those monks finish their meal and refuse an invitation to eat more, and then eat elsewhere?” …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc35:1.15.pli: “saccaṃ kira, bhikkhave, bhikkhū bhuttāvī pavāritā aññatra bhuñjantī”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc35:1.15.eng: “Is it true, monks, that monks did this?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc35:1.18.pli: kathañhi nāma te, bhikkhave, moghapurisā bhuttāvī pavāritā aññatra bhuñjissanti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc35:1.18.eng: “How could those foolish men do this?

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc35:1.20.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc35:1.20.eng: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc35:1.21.1.pli: “Yo pana bhikkhu bhuttāvī pavārito khādanīyaṃ vā bhojanīyaṃ vā khādeyya vā bhuñjeyya vā, pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc35:1.21.1.eng: ‘If a monk has finished his meal and refused an invitation to eat more, and then eats fresh or cooked food, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc35:1.21.1.comm: I normally render pavārita as “invited”, but the word also means “satisfied”. In the present case, the contextual meaning (see below) is that the monk has expressed his satisfaction after being invited to take more, thus “refused an invitation to eat more”.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc35:1.22.pli: Evañcidaṃ bhagavatā bhikkhūnaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ paññattaṃ hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc35:1.22.eng: In this way the Buddha laid down this training rule for the monks.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc35:2.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhū gilānānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ paṇīte piṇḍapāte nīharanti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc35:2.1.eng: Soon afterwards the monks were bringing back fine almsfood for the sick monks.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc35:2.2.eng: But because the sick monks were unable to eat as much as they had intended,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc35:2.3.eng: the monks threw the leftovers away.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc35:2.4.pli: Assosi kho bhagavā uccāsaddaṃ mahāsaddaṃ kākoravasaddaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc35:2.4.eng: When the Buddha heard the loud sound of crows cawing,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc35:2.6.pli: “kiṃ nu kho so, ānanda, uccāsaddo mahāsaddo kākoravasaddo”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc35:2.6.eng: “Ānanda, why is there this loud sound of crows cawing?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc35:2.7.pli: Atha kho āyasmā ānando bhagavato etamatthaṃ ārocesi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc35:2.7.eng: Ānanda told him what had happened, and the Buddha said,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc35:2.8.eng: “But Ānanda, don’t the monks eat the leftovers from those who are sick?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc35:2.10.pli: Atha kho bhagavā etasmiṃ nidāne etasmiṃ pakaraṇe dhammiṃ kathaṃ katvā bhikkhū āmantesi—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc35:2.10.eng: Soon afterwards the Buddha gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc35:2.11.pli: “anujānāmi, bhikkhave, gilānassa ca agilānassa ca atirittaṃ bhuñjituṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc35:2.11.eng: “Monks, I allow you to eat the leftovers both from those who are sick and from those who are not sick.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc35:2.12.eng: And, monks, this is how you make food left over:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc35:2.14.pli: Evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc35:2.14.eng: And so, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc35:2.15.1.pli: “Yo pana bhikkhu bhuttāvī pavārito anatirittaṃ khādanīyaṃ vā bhojanīyaṃ vā khādeyya vā bhuñjeyya vā, pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc35:2.15.1.eng: ‘If a monk has finished his meal and refused an invitation to eat more, and then eats fresh or cooked food that is not left over, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc35:3.1.4.eng: … The monk who has been given the full ordination by a unanimous Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc35:3.1.6.pli: pañcannaṃ bhojanānaṃ aññataraṃ bhojanaṃ antamaso kusaggenapi bhuttaṃ hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc35:3.1.6.eng: has eaten any of the five cooked foods, even what fits on the tip of a blade of grass.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc35:3.1.7.eng: Refused an invitation to eat more:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc35:3.1.7.comm: For a discussion of the word pavāreti, see Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc35:3.1.8.pli: asanaṃ paññāyati, bhojanaṃ paññāyati, hatthapāse ṭhito abhiharati, paṭikkhepo paññāyati.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc35:3.1.8.eng: there is eating; there is cooked food; they stand within arm’s reach; there is an offering; there is a refusal.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc35:3.1.8.comm: The punctuation of the Pali is wrong. According to Pvr 17:66.1 there are five aspects to such a refusal, and thus an additional comma is required between ṭhito and abhiharati. “They” refers to the donor, whether male or female.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc35:3.1.10.eng: the making it left over is done with food that is unallowable;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc35:3.1.10.comm: Literally, “It is done with what is unallowable.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc35:3.1.11.eng: it is done with food that has not been received;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc35:3.1.11.comm: The “it”, both here and below, refers to the ceremony of making it left over.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc35:3.1.12.eng: it is done with food that is not held in hand;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc35:3.1.13.eng: it is done by one who is not within arm’s reach;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc35:3.1.14.eng: it is done by one who has not finished his meal;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc35:3.1.15.pli: bhuttāvinā pavāritena āsanā vuṭṭhitena kataṃ hoti,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc35:3.1.15.eng: it is done by one who has finished his meal, who has refused an invitation to eat more, but who has risen from his seat;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc35:3.1.16.eng: “I’ve had enough,” has not been said;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc35:3.1.17.eng: it is not left over from one who is sick—

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc35:3.1.20.eng: the making it left over is done with food that is allowable;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc35:3.1.21.eng: it is done with food that has been received;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc35:3.1.22.eng: it is done with food that is held in hand;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc35:3.1.23.eng: it is done by one who is within arm’s reach;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc35:3.1.24.eng: it is done by one who has finished his meal;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc35:3.1.25.pli: bhuttāvinā pavāritena āsanā avuṭṭhitena kataṃ hoti,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc35:3.1.25.eng: it is done by one who has finished his meal, who has refused an invitation to eat more, and who has not risen from his seat;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc35:3.1.27.eng: it is left over from one who is sick—

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc35:3.1.30.pli: pañca bhojanāni—yāmakālikaṃ sattāhakālikaṃ yāvajīvikaṃ ṭhapetvā avasesaṃ khādanīyaṃ nāma.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc35:3.1.30.eng: apart from the five cooked foods, the post-midday tonics, the seven-day tonics, and the lifetime tonics—the rest is called “fresh food”.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc35:3.1.30.comm: “Fresh food” renders khādanīya. See Appendix of Technical Terms for discussion.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc35:3.1.31.comm: “Cooked food” renders bhojanīya. See Appendix of Technical Terms for discussion.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc35:3.1.32.pli: pañca bhojanāni— odano, kummāso, sattu, maccho, maṃsaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc35:3.1.32.eng: there are five kinds of cooked food: cooked grain, porridge, flour products, fish, and meat.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc35:3.1.33.pli: “Khādissāmi bhuñjissāmī”ti paṭiggaṇhāti, āpatti dukkaṭassa ajjhohāre ajjhohāre āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc35:3.1.33.eng: If he receives it intending to eat it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct. For every mouthful swallowed, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc35:3.2.1.pli: Anatiritte anatirittasaññī khādanīyaṃ vā bhojanīyaṃ vā khādati vā bhuñjati vā, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc35:3.2.1.eng: If it is not left over, and he does not perceive it as such, and he eats fresh or cooked food, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc35:3.2.2.pli: Anatiritte vematiko khādanīyaṃ vā bhojanīyaṃ vā khādati vā bhuñjati vā, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc35:3.2.2.eng: If it is not left over, but he is unsure of it, and he eats fresh or cooked food, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc35:3.2.3.pli: Anatiritte atirittasaññī khādanīyaṃ vā bhojanīyaṃ vā khādati vā bhuñjati vā, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc35:3.2.3.eng: If it is not left over, but he perceives it as such, and he eats fresh or cooked food, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc35:3.2.4.pli: Yāmakālikaṃ sattāhakālikaṃ yāvajīvikaṃ āhāratthāya paṭiggaṇhāti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc35:3.2.4.eng: If he receives post-midday tonics, seven-day tonics, or lifetime tonics for the purpose of food, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc35:3.2.5.eng: For every mouthful swallowed, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc35:3.2.6.eng: If it is left over, but he does not perceive it as such, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc35:3.2.7.eng: If it is left over, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc35:3.2.8.eng: If it is left over, and he perceives it as such, there is no offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc35:3.3.2.eng: if he eats it after having it made left over;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc35:3.3.3.eng: if he receives it with the intention of having it made left over and then eating it;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc35:3.3.4.eng: if he is taking food for the benefit of someone else;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc35:3.3.5.eng: if he eats the leftovers from a sick person;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc35:3.3.6.pli: yāmakālikaṃ sattāhakālikaṃ yāvajīvikaṃ sati paccaye paribhuñjati,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc35:3.3.6.eng: if, when there is a reason, he uses post-midday tonics, seven-day tonics, or lifetime tonics;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc35:3.3.8.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc35:3.3.9.eng: The training rule on invitations, the fifth, is finished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc36:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing confession

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc36:0.5.eng: 36. The second training rule on invitations

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc36:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc36:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc36:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena dve bhikkhū kosalesu janapade sāvatthiṃ addhānamaggappaṭipannā honti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc36:1.2.eng: At that time two monks were traveling through the Kosalan country on their way to Sāvatthī.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc36:1.4.eng: and the other said to him,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc36:1.6.eng: Because of that the first monk became resentful.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc36:1.7.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū sāvatthiṃ agamaṃsu.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc36:1.7.eng: They then carried on to Sāvatthī.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc36:1.8.pli: Tena kho pana samayena sāvatthiyaṃ aññatarassa pūgassa saṅghabhattaṃ hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc36:1.8.eng: Soon afterwards an association in Sāvatthī was offering a meal to the Sangha.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc36:1.9.eng: When the second monk had finished his meal and refused an invitation to eat more,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc36:1.10.pli: Upanaddho bhikkhu ñātikulaṃ gantvā piṇḍapātaṃ ādāya yena so bhikkhu tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā taṃ bhikkhuṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc36:1.10.eng: the resentful monk brought back some almsfood from his own family. He then said to the other,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc36:1.14.pli: Atha kho so bhikkhu tena bhikkhunā nippīḷiyamāno taṃ piṇḍapātaṃ bhuñji.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc36:1.14.eng: And because he was pressured, he ate the almsfood.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc36:1.15.eng: The resentful monk then said to him,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc36:1.16.pli: “tvampi nāma, āvuso, maṃ vattabbaṃ maññasi yaṃ tvaṃ bhuttāvī pavārito anatirittaṃ bhojanaṃ bhuñjasī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc36:1.16.eng: “Who are you to correct me when you eat food that’s not left over even though you have finished your meal and refused an invitation to eat more?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc36:1.17.comm: That is, why did he not say that the food was not left over.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc36:1.19.pli: Atha kho so bhikkhu bhikkhūnaṃ etamatthaṃ ārocesi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc36:1.19.eng: The second monk told the monks what had happened,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc36:1.20.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc36:1.20.eng: and the monks of few desires complained and criticized the other,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc36:1.21.pli: “kathañhi nāma bhikkhu bhikkhuṃ bhuttāviṃ pavāritaṃ anatirittena bhojanena abhihaṭṭhuṃ pavāressatī”ti …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc36:1.21.eng: “How could a monk invite another monk to eat food that’s not left over, when the other has finished his meal and refused an invitation to eat more ?” …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc36:1.22.pli: “saccaṃ kira tvaṃ, bhikkhu, bhikkhuṃ bhuttāviṃ pavāritaṃ anatirittena bhojanena abhihaṭṭhuṃ pavāresī”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc36:1.22.eng: “Is it true, monk, that you did this?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc36:1.25.pli: kathañhi nāma tvaṃ, moghapurisa, bhikkhuṃ bhuttāviṃ pavāritaṃ anatirittena bhojanena abhihaṭṭhuṃ pavāressasi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc36:1.25.eng: “Foolish man, how could you do this?

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc36:1.27.pli: evañca pana bhikkhave imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc36:1.27.eng: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc36:1.28.1.pli: “Yo pana bhikkhu bhikkhuṃ bhuttāviṃ pavāritaṃ anatirittena khādanīyena vā bhojanīyena vā abhihaṭṭhuṃ pavāreyya—‘handa, bhikkhu, khāda vā bhuñja vā’ti, jānaṃ āsādanāpekkho, bhuttasmiṃ, pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc36:1.28.1.eng: ‘If a monk invites a monk, whom he knows has finished his meal and refused an invitation to eat more, to eat fresh or cooked food that is not left over, saying, “Here, monk, eat,” aiming to criticize him, then when the other has eaten, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc36:2.1.4.eng: … The monk who has been given the full ordination by a unanimous Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc36:2.1.8.pli: pañcannaṃ bhojanānaṃ aññataraṃ bhojanaṃ, antamaso kusaggenapi bhuttaṃ hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc36:2.1.8.eng: whom has eaten any of the five cooked foods, even what fits on the tip of a blade of grass.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc36:2.1.9.eng: Refused an invitation to eat more:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc36:2.1.10.pli: asanaṃ paññāyati, bhojanaṃ paññāyati, hatthapāse ṭhito abhiharati, paṭikkhepo paññāyati.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc36:2.1.10.eng: there is eating; there is cooked food; they stand within arm’s reach; there is an offering; there is a refusal.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc36:2.1.10.comm: As with the previous rule, the punctuation of the Pali is wrong. An additional comma is required between ṭhito and abhiharati. “They” refers to the donor, whether male or female.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc36:2.1.12.eng: the making it left over is done with food that is unallowable;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc36:2.1.12.comm: Literally, “It is done with what is not allowable.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc36:2.1.13.eng: it is done with food that has not been received;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc36:2.1.13.comm: The “it”, both here and below, refers to the ceremony of making it left over.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc36:2.1.14.eng: it is done with food that is not held in hand;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc36:2.1.15.eng: it is done by one who is not within arm’s reach;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc36:2.1.16.eng: it is done by one who has not finished his meal;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc36:2.1.17.pli: bhuttāvinā pavāritena āsanā vuṭṭhitena kataṃ hoti,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc36:2.1.17.eng: it is done by one who has finished his meal, who has refused an invitation to eat more, but who has risen from his seat;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc36:2.1.18.eng: “I’ve had enough,” has not been said;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc36:2.1.19.eng: it is not left over from one who is sick—

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc36:2.1.22.pli: pañca bhojanāni—yāmakālikaṃ sattāhakālikaṃ yāvajīvikaṃ ṭhapetvā avasesaṃ khādanīyaṃ nāma.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc36:2.1.22.eng: apart from the five cooked foods, the post-midday tonics, the seven-day tonics, and the lifetime tonics—the rest is called “fresh food”.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc36:2.1.24.pli: pañca bhojanāni—odano, kummāso, sattu, maccho, maṃsaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc36:2.1.24.eng: there are five kinds of cooked food: cooked grain, porridge, flour products, fish, and meat.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc36:2.1.26.eng: saying, “Take as much as you like.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc36:2.1.28.pli: sāmaṃ vā jānāti, aññe vā tassa ārocenti, so vā āroceti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc36:2.1.28.eng: he knows by himself or others have told him or the monk has told him.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc36:2.1.28.comm: The meaning of the last of these three ways of knowing, so vā āroceti, is not clear. CPD suggests: “sa (sā) āroceti (?). Perhaps this last form is conformable to sa. ārocayate med. caus. in the meaning: he or she makes inquiries (of others).” However, this does not fit with the parallel usage at Bu Pc 29:3.1.6 where the text says that she tells (sā vā āroceti) him, presumably referring to the nun telling the monk. In this case āroceti cannot refer to the monk making inquiries. The commentaries are silent, and I therefore assume that a straightforward meaning is the most likely one. I would suggest, then, that it simply refers to the recipient telling the resentful monk directly.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc36:2.1.30.pli: “iminā imaṃ codessāmi sāressāmi paṭicodessāmi paṭisāressāmi maṅkuṃ karissāmī”ti abhiharati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc36:2.1.30.eng: if he offers it to him, thinking, “With this I’ll accuse him,” “I’ll remind him,” “I’ll counter accuse him,” “I’ll counter remind him,” “I’ll humiliate him,” he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc36:2.1.31.pli: Tassa vacanena “khādissāmi bhuñjissāmī”ti paṭiggaṇhāti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc36:2.1.31.eng: If, because of what he says, the other monk receives it with the intention of eating it, then the donor commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc36:2.1.32.eng: For every mouthful swallowed, the donor commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc36:2.1.33.eng: When the other monk has finished eating, the donor commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc36:2.2.1.pli: Pavārite pavāritasaññī anatirittena khādanīyena vā bhojanīyena vā abhihaṭṭhuṃ pavāreti, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc36:2.2.1.eng: If the other monk has refused an invitation to eat more, and the donor perceives that he has, and he invites him to eat fresh or cooked food that is not left over, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc36:2.2.2.pli: Pavārite vematiko anatirittena khādanīyena vā bhojanīyena vā abhihaṭṭhuṃ pavāreti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc36:2.2.2.eng: If the other monk has refused an invitation to eat more, but the donor is unsure of it, and he invites him to eat fresh or cooked food that is not left over, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc36:2.2.3.pli: Pavārite appavāritasaññī anatirittena khādanīyena vā bhojanīyena vā abhihaṭṭhuṃ pavāreti, anāpatti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc36:2.2.3.eng: If the other monk has refused an invitation to eat more, but the donor does not perceive that he has, and he invites him to eat fresh or cooked food that is not left over, there is no offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc36:2.2.4.pli: Yāmakālikaṃ sattāhakālikaṃ yāvajīvikaṃ āhāratthāya abhiharati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc36:2.2.4.eng: If he invites him to eat post-midday tonics, seven-day tonics, or lifetime tonics for the purpose of food, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc36:2.2.5.pli: Tassa vacanena “khādissāmi bhuñjissāmī”ti paṭiggaṇhāti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc36:2.2.5.eng: If, because of what he says, the other monk receives it with the intention of eating it, then the donor commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc36:2.2.6.eng: For every mouthful swallowed, the donor commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc36:2.2.7.eng: If the other monk has not refused an invitation to eat more, but the donor perceives that he has, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc36:2.2.8.eng: If the other monk has not refused an invitation to eat more, but the donor is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc36:2.2.9.eng: If the other monk has not refused an invitation to eat more, and the donor does not perceive that he has, there is no offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc36:2.3.2.eng: if he gives it after having it made left over;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc36:2.3.3.eng: if he gives it, saying, “Have it made left over and then eat it;”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc36:2.3.4.eng: if he gives it, saying, “Take this food for the benefit of someone else;”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc36:2.3.5.eng: if he gives the leftovers from a sick person;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc36:2.3.6.pli: “yāmakālikaṃ sattāhakālikaṃ yāvajīvikaṃ sati paccaye paribhuñjā”ti deti,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc36:2.3.6.eng: if he gives, saying, “When there’s a reason, use these post-midday tonics,” “… use these seven-day tonics,” “… use  these lifetime tonics;”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc36:2.3.8.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc36:2.3.9.eng: The second training rule on invitations, the sixth, is finished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc37:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing confession

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc37:0.5.eng: 37. The training rule on eating at the wrong time

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc37:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā rājagahe viharati veḷuvane kalandakanivāpe.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc37:1.1.eng: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Rājagaha in the Bamboo Grove,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc37:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena rājagahe giraggasamajjo hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc37:1.2.eng: there was a hilltop fair in Rājagaha,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc37:1.3.eng: which the monks from the group of seventeen went to see.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc37:1.4.pli: Manussā sattarasavaggiye bhikkhū passitvā nahāpetvā vilimpetvā bhojetvā khādanīyaṃ adaṃsu.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc37:1.4.eng: When people saw the monks, they bathed them, anointed them, fed them cooked food, and gave them fresh food.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc37:1.5.pli: Sattarasavaggiyā bhikkhū khādanīyaṃ ādāya ārāmaṃ gantvā chabbaggiye bhikkhū etadavocuṃ—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc37:1.5.eng: They took that food and brought it back to the monastery. And they said to the monks from the group of six,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc37:1.7.eng: “But where did you get this food?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc37:1.8.pli: Sattarasavaggiyā bhikkhū chabbaggiyānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc37:1.8.eng: And they told them what had happened.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc37:1.9.pli: “Kiṃ pana tumhe, āvuso, vikāle bhojanaṃ bhuñjathā”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc37:1.9.eng: “So, do you eat at the wrong time?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc37:1.11.eng: The monks from the group of six complained and criticized them,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc37:1.12.pli: “kathañhi nāma sattarasavaggiyā bhikkhū vikāle bhojanaṃ bhuñjissantī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc37:1.12.eng: “How can those monks from the group of seventeen eat at the wrong time?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc37:1.13.pli: Atha kho chabbaggiyā bhikkhū bhikkhūnaṃ etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc37:1.14.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc37:1.14.eng: and the monks of few desires complained and criticized them,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc37:1.15.pli: “kathañhi nāma sattarasavaggiyā bhikkhū vikāle bhojanaṃ bhuñjissantī”ti …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc37:1.15.eng: “How can the monks from the group of seventeen eat at the wrong time?” …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc37:1.16.pli: “saccaṃ kira tumhe, bhikkhave, vikāle bhojanaṃ bhuñjathā”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc37:1.16.eng: “Is it true, monks, that you do this?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc37:1.19.pli: kathañhi nāma tumhe, moghapurisā, vikāle bhojanaṃ bhuñjissatha.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc37:1.19.eng: “Foolish men, how can you do this?

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc37:1.21.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc37:1.21.eng: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc37:1.22.1.pli: “Yo pana bhikkhu vikāle khādanīyaṃ vā bhojanīyaṃ vā khādeyya vā bhuñjeyya vā, pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc37:1.22.1.eng: ‘If a monk eats fresh or cooked food at the wrong time, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc37:2.1.4.eng: … The monk who has been given the full ordination by a unanimous Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc37:2.1.6.eng: when the middle of the day has passed, until dawn.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc37:2.1.8.pli: pañca bhojanāni—yāmakālikaṃ sattāhakālikaṃ yāvajīvikaṃ ṭhapetvā avasesaṃ khādanīyaṃ nāma.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc37:2.1.8.eng: apart from the five cooked foods, the post-midday tonics, the seven-day tonics, and the lifetime tonics—the rest is called “fresh food”.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc37:2.1.10.pli: pañca bhojanāni—odano, kummāso, sattu, maccho, maṃsaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc37:2.1.10.eng: there are five kinds of cooked food: cooked grain, porridge, flour products, fish, and meat.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc37:2.1.11.eng: If he receives fresh or cooked food with the intention of eating it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc37:2.1.12.eng: For every mouthful swallowed, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc37:2.2.1.pli: Vikāle vikālasaññī khādanīyaṃ vā bhojanīyaṃ vā khādati vā bhuñjati vā, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc37:2.2.1.eng: If it is the wrong time, and he perceives it as such, and he eats fresh or cooked food, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc37:2.2.2.pli: Vikāle vematiko khādanīyaṃ vā bhojanīyaṃ vā khādati vā bhuñjati vā, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc37:2.2.2.eng: If it is the wrong time, but he is unsure of it, and he eats fresh or cooked food, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc37:2.2.3.pli: Vikāle kālasaññī khādanīyaṃ vā bhojanīyaṃ vā khādati vā bhuñjati vā, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc37:2.2.3.eng: If it is the wrong time, but he perceives it as the right time, and he eats fresh or cooked food, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc37:2.2.4.pli: Yāmakālikaṃ sattāhakālikaṃ yāvajīvikaṃ āhāratthāya paṭiggaṇhāti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc37:2.2.4.eng: If he receives post-midday tonics, seven-day tonics, or lifetime tonics for the purpose of food, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc37:2.2.5.eng: For every mouthful swallowed, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc37:2.2.6.eng: If it is the right time, but he perceives it as the wrong time, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc37:2.2.7.eng: If it is the right time, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc37:2.2.8.eng: If it is the right time, and he perceives it as such, there is no offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc37:2.3.2.pli: yāmakālikaṃ sattāhakālikaṃ yāvajīvikaṃ sati paccaye paribhuñjati,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc37:2.3.2.eng: if, when there is a reason, he uses post-midday tonics, seven-day tonics, or lifetime tonics;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc37:2.3.4.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc37:2.3.5.eng: The training rule on eating at the wrong time, the seventh, is finished.
